Detailed Description

A thermodynamic database that uses the Rigid-Rotator Harmonic-Oscillator model for computing species thermodynamic properties.

See the individual thermodynamic functions for specific descriptions of the model.

Member Function Documentation

◆ cp()

void cp ( double  Th,
double  Te,
double  Tr,
double  Tv,
double  Tel,
double *const  cp,
double *const  cpt,
double *const  cpr,
double *const  cpv,
double *const  cpel 
)
inlinevirtual

Computes the unitless species specific heat at constant pressure \( C_{P,i} / R_U\) in thermal nonequilibrium.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
cp- on return, the array of species non-dimensional \(C_P\)'s
cpt- if not NULL, the array of species translational \(C_P\)'s
cpr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational \(C_P\)'s
cpv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational \(C_P\)'s
cpel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic \(C_P\)'s
Todo:
Compute \(C_P\) directly instead of using finite-differencs.

Implements ThermoDB.

◆ cpint()

void cpint ( double  T,
double *const  cp 
)
virtualinherited

Computes the unitless internal specific heat.

The default behavior is to simply provide \(c_{p,\text{int}} = c_p(T) - 2.5\) for all species.

Parameters
Ttemperature assigned to internal energy modes

double *const  cvel = NULL 
)
virtualinherited

Computes the unitless species specific heats at constant volume \( C_{v,i} / R_U\) of each species in thermal nonequilibrium.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperatures
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
cv- if not NULL, the array of species non-dimensional cv
cvt- if not NULL, the array of species translational cv
cvr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational cv
cvv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational cv
cvel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic cv

Definition at line 83 of file ThermoDB.h.

◆ enthalpy()

void enthalpy ( double  Th,
double  Te,
double  Tr,
double  Tv,
double  Tel,
double *const  h,
double *const  ht,
double *const  hr,
double *const  hv,
double *const  hel,
double *const  hf 
)
inlinevirtual

Computes the unitless species enthalpy \( h_i/R_U T_h\) of each species in thermal nonequilibrium, which is non-dimensionalized by the heavy particle translational temperature.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
h- on return, the array of species non-dimensional enthalpies
ht- if not NULL, the array of species translational enthalpies
hr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational enthalpies
hv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational enthalpies
hel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic enthalpies
hf- if not NULL, the array of the species formation enthalpies

Implements ThermoDB.

Definition at line 254 of file RrhoDB.cpp.

◆ entropy()

void entropy ( double  Th,
double  Te,
double  Tr,
double  Tv,
double  Tel,
double  P,
double *const  s,
double *const  st,
double *const  sr,
double *const  sv,
double *const  sel 
)
inlinevirtual

Computes the unitless species entropy \(s_i/R_u\) allowing for thermal nonequilibrium.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
s- on return, the array of species non-dimensional entropies
st- if not NULL, the array of species translational entropies
sr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational entropies
sv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational entropies
sel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic entropies

Implements ThermoDB.
